title: How Mike Tyson's friendship with Tupac Shakur was brutally cut short on fight night
text:

Mike Tyson had just clambered back through the ropes following his quick-fire victory over Bruce Seldon when he was joined by one of his VIP guests.

Tupac Shakur, considered one of the best rappers of all time at the age of 25, leapt from his ringside seat to hug the heavyweight world champion.

He would then accompany Tyson to his post-fight press conference before leaving the MGM Grand in Las Vegas.

The pair would never speak again.

“It’s very difficult to talk about," a teary Tyson said in an emotional interview last year . "He was just a young kid, and he wanted to be great – and then that happened."

(Image: Tupac Shakur/Instagram)

That same evening in September 1996, Tupac was shot four times; twice in the chest, once in the arm and once in the thigh as he made his way to an after party at Club 662.

Tyson had also planned to stop in on the party but instead decided to go home to see his new-born baby.

Tupac, who had been travelling with record producer Suge Knight, died six days later and his killer has never been brought to justice.

"He was really happy after the fight," Tyson said. “He came to the press conference with me. We was just talking a bunch of s***. I went home and then he left.

"I was home sleeping [when he was shot]. They wouldn't let me see him."

Tyson was rebuilding his career following his shock defeat by James 'Buster' Douglas when he met Tupac.

Then 20, the rapper was attempting to gain entry to a party in Los Angeles hosted by basketball legend Magic Johnson.

(Image: Reuters)

Tyson convinced the doormen to let Tupac and his crew - which amounted to some 200 people - into the Palladium building

"Him and his guys got the mic somehow and started rapping," Tyson later told MTV. "The whole crowd started going crazy, they loved him."

The next time Tyson saw Tupac, the crowd went crazy again - only this time they were fellow inmates of the dethroned champion.

Sentenced to six years for rape in 1992, Tyson received the rapper as a visitor after his mum had written to the boxer.

"The white prisoners, the guards, everybody went crazy in this redneck prison," Tyson added. "They went nuts when he came in there. I didn't know he was famous like that."

Tupac would visit Tyson repeatedly in prison while the pair also spoke on the phone.

(Image: The LIFE Images Collection via G)

But during Tyson's spell behind bars, his friend would also be arrested on sexual assault charges and sentenced to his own term inside.

He would serve nine months before being released in October 1995, 11 months before he was shot.

"When I came back in 1995 and I was fighting Bruce Seldon, he came to the fight," Tyson has said.

"Man, he was very excited because we had both been incarcerated and we both came out and we were very successful, like we both thought we would be."

But Tupac would never realise his full potential - and Tyson lost his world title in his next fight, the first installment of his rivalry with Evander Holyfield.

"I’m glad to be a part of his life and to have known him," the boxer said. "Of all the things Mike Tyson can regret in his life – you know that whole rape thing, the jail thing, the biting the ear thing – his biggest regret is not smoking with 'Pac."
description: Tupac Shakur was shot dead following Tyson's heavyweight fight against Bruce Seldon in 1996
authors: The Life Images Collection Via G
